item.title: WoW's Housing System Will Reward Decor Based On Past Achievements
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/wow-housing-system-will-reward-decor-based-on-past-achievements/1100-6531163/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

When player housing arrives in World of Warcraft, players will be retroactively rewarded for past achievements in the form of housing decor, with Blizzard stating "all the time spent in Azeroth is worth something."

In a new blog post, Blizzard continues to pull back the veil on WoW's long-awaited player housing system, confirming that players will be able to earn housing decor in a number of different ways. Common items like chairs, shelfs, beds, etc. will be widely available from vendors, quests, or other players via the auction house.

Some decor, however, will take more time or effort to unlock. Blizzard described these as "investment" items that may require more time or a significant cost to earn. Housing decor can also come in the form of "Trophies," rewards from long-term achievements or completing specific feats that require skillful play, with Blizzard comparing them to current Mythic+ or raid rewards.

Blizzard confirmed that new decor rewards tied to past achievements or feats will be rewarded retroactively the first time a player logs in, and that some decor will be integrated into past expansions for players to unlock using expansion-specific systems or currencies.

Professions from each expansion, too, will play an important role. All non-gathering professions will be able to craft items for housing, with Blizzard laying out a few examples. Blacksmiths will be able to make objects made primarily of metal, enchanters will be able to create magical objects, and jewelcrafters will craft stone-related objects and gem-studded decorations. Decor from previous expansions will require corresponding reagents and the relevant profession level from that expansion, giving players more reasons to go back into the game's past.

Blizzard said the goal of decorating a home properly shouldn't be difficult, but it does want to give players some "reach-goals" throughout the game to shoot for.

"That said, it should be easily possible to kit out your home on day one to strike the vibe you're looking for without too much effort," Blizzard said. "Your decor journey should start out awesome and continue to be that all along the way."

Other details shared by Blizzard include that decor items are shared across a player's entire account, so if they have four chairs total and use three of them in the house for one of their characters, other characters will only have one left to use. Some items will also be limited to how many copies players can have, with an example being that it doesn't make sense to have nine copies of Onyxia's head mounted on the wall.

For WoW players looking for something more to do ahead of housing's arrival, Blizzard hinted that leveling up professions from previous expansions, as well as completing meta-achievements, might be goals worth pursuing for those looking to get a head start on decorating their homes.

This is just the latest glimpse at WoW's player housing system, which still does not have a release date but is said to be coming alongside the arrival of the MMORPG's next expansion, Midnight. Blizzard previously stressed that housing in WoW will be available to everyone and won't come with "exorbitant requirements." It also revealed the systems players will be using to decorate their homes, as well as how its neighborhood housing system will work.

item.title: Battlefield 6 Gameplay Leaks Show Off Impressive Destruction And Gunplay
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/battlefield-6-gameplay-leaks-show-off-impressive-destruction-and-gunplay/1100-6531158/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

EA and DICE recently conducted the latest Battlefield Labs testing period for Battlefield 6, and despite participants agreeing to not share footage online, that's exactly what's happened. Lots of new gameplay videos from the alpha test recently made their way online, and the footage looks pretty impressive.

Among other things, the videos show off Battlefield 6's new destruction elements, while we also see player piloting a jet, zipping across a massive map. Other videos show off some of the game's numerous ground-based vehicles. You can check out the footage in some of the social media clips below.

Battlefield 6 gameplay footage has been leaking all over the place, dating back to the first Battlefield Labs test earlier this year. Responding to the leaks, a top Battlefield boss reminded fans that early alpha footage is not necessarily representative of the final product. And while DICE encourages fans to submit feedback, the developer has its own development plans, too.

It's not too late to sign up for Battlefield Labs to possibly get into a future test. Battlefield 6, or whatever the game might be called, has been rumored to release in Fall 2025, but EA has only confirmed that it'll be out by March 2026. CEO Andrew Wilson recently said EA could shift the game to potentially avoid a clash with GTA 6.

In addition to multiplayer, the next Battlefield game will have a single-player component developed by Motive and an unannounced mode from Ripple Effect that is rumored to be the return of Portal mode.

Battlefield 6 will be the first new entry since 2021's Battlefield 2042, a game that had a poor launch and ended up selling below expectations for EA. DICE management blamed the poor results on developers working from home during the height of COVID, among other things.

item.title: Hyper Light Breaker Update Brings A More Traditional Roguelike Experience
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/hyper-light-breaker-update-brings-a-more-traditional-roguelike-experience/1100-6531151/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Hyper Light Breaker's first major content update arrives on April 29 and will bring with it major changes to the core gameplay loop, as well as brand-new content including a new Breaker and new Crown.

Lead producer Michael Clark introduced the update in a new trailer, leading with the fearsome new Crown called Maw. Maw has already been teased in the game, and her arena is available pre-update, but this will be the first time players can take her on in combat.

The new Breaker is called Rondo, who has a new SyCom with two new perks: Bladedancer and Reaper. The content update also inroduces two new weapons for players to wield: the Gloom Shiv and the Dreamblade. The update will also add new environments, a new enemy, and more that the devs haven't yet detailed.

The new content isn't the biggest part of the upcoming update, however, with Clark revealing that Hyper Light Breaker is getting a major shakeup to its core run structure. Once the update hits, you will have one life for each run, and upon death you will lose all items in your inventory and the Overgrowth will reset. Clark explains that this change will bring Hyper Light Breaker more in line with a traditional roguelike experience.

Players will now get more chances to extract from the Overgrowth, being able to do so from any Shrine, and will no longer have to defeat enemies to do so. SyComs will now follow a class-like structure where every character will have one dedicated SyCom, which can have a perk equipped to enable a passive ability. Inventory will be streamlined so that players no longer have to spend so much time managing inventory, and vendors' roles have also been changed.

The update will also add a brand-new onboarding tutorial aimed at making Hyper Light Breaker more approachable to new players. The tutorial will launch for all players post-update, even if they've already sunk a lot of hours into the game.

Many of the overarching changes made to the game were inspired by player feedback, Heart Machine said in a Steam update, thanking players for being a part of the process as Hyper Light Breaker makes its way through early access.

The Buried Below update arrives on April 29 for Hyper Light Breaker on PC.

item.title: Diablo 4 Season 8 Patch Notes Introduce Endgame Boss Overhaul
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/diablo-4-season-8-patch-notes-introduce-endgame-boss-overhaul/1100-6531150/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Blizzard has released the patch notes for Diablo 4 Patch 2.2.0, set to drop at the start of Season 8 on April 29. The patch includes a huge number of minor balance changes for player characters, items, and bosses, as part of Blizzard's ongoing plan to improve the core gameplay experience throughout 2025. Here's what's new.

While there aren't many surprises in the patch notes, as Blizzard has spoken fairly extensively about the Season 8 changes, as well as letting players get hands-on with the new seasonal content in the PTR, a few changes will be made based on PTR feedback. The fearsome final form of Belial, who lends his name to the season, has been made even more challenging than it was in the PTR beta, with higher health, damage, and a few new moves up his sleeve.

Belial isn't the only boss getting a buff from his PTR form--all the Lair Bosses are getting at least minor tweaks or buffs to up the challenge level. Duriel and Gregoire will get new fight mechanics, Lord Zir is getting a damage buff, and Beast in the Ice has some minor tweaks. Varshan is the only one getting an update aimed at making the fight easier--or at least easier to read, thanks to a change to how Tormented Echo of Varshan functions.

Season 8 is introducing a new mechanic called Boss Powers, where players can literally wield some of the powers used by endgame bosses, which PTR players may have had a bit too much fun with. The version of this mechanic tested in the PTR was evidently way too powerful, as a good number of Boss Powers are getting significant nerfs from their initial PTR stats.

In news that many players might be happy to hear, Blizzard will be disabling Conduit shrines "until further notice" as they undertake a rework for the controversial shrines. The patch notes say that the decision was made as a result of player feedback, with many Diablo 4 fans feeling like Conduit shrines have become all but useless with recent patches.

Alongside the big-ticket boss reworks, the patch notes contain a whole lot of small balance changes and minor but welcome quality-of-life upgrades. These include a minor buff for Barbarians, with a specific focus on Whirlwind, improvements to Party Finder, and the ability to quickly teleport to other party members.

  • Fixed an issue where some of the text on the Que rune was displaying in the incorrect font style.
  • Fixed an issue where the Neo rune would not generate offering when blocking damage with a Barrier.

  • Fixed an issue where the Poc rune effect did not consistently trigger when using Unlimited Spirit granted by Mjölnic Ryng.
  • Fixed an issue where the Que rune would trigger Druid's Backlash passive.

  • Fixed an issue where the removed Rune, Met, could still drop in rare circumstances.(Hey! Who let the Met rune hangout near the campfire again?)

Miscellaneous

  • Fixed an issue where two identical timers for Kurast Undercity runs would display while playing in Local Co-Op.

    • Initiate Lair Bosses: Beast in the Ice, Grigoire, Lord Zir, Varshan, and Urivar (available for Vessel of Hatred owners only).
    • Greater Lair Bosses: Andariel, Duriel, and Harbringer of Hatred (available for Vessel of Hatred owners only).
    • Exalted Lair Bosses: Belial, Lord of Lies.
  • Initiate, Greater, and Exalted Lair Bosses
    • Lair Bosses no longer require boss materials to summon and no longer drop loot upon death. Instead, when a Lair boss dies, a chest called a Hoard will spawn containing its loot. Each player must individually spend boss materials, called Hoard Keys, to open their Hoard. Here’s the Hoard Key cost per Lair Boss type:
      • Initiate: 12
      • Greater: 4 3
      • 4 2
    • The first Unique item dropped by a Lair Boss will be from their unique pool. Further Unique Items will have a 50% chance to be from the general Unique pool. In Torment Difficulty III, an additional guaranteed Unique item from the item pool will drop.
    • When playing in a party, Lair Bosses have a 33% chance per additional party member to drop an extra Unique Item from their unique pool.
    • Lair Bosses now drop 7 Unique Items on Torment IV, instead of 6.
    • Increased the number of Hoard Keys you receive each time:
      • Helltide Chests will drop more Living Steel.
      • Nightmare Dungeons will drop more Distilled Fear.
      • Blood Maiden will drop more Exquisite Blood for each contributed Baneful Heart.
      • Legion Events drop more Exquisite Blood.
      • World Bosses drop more Exquisite Blood.
      • Random Boss Keys are more likely to be a key other than Malignant Heart.
  • Rewards from the Purveyor of Curiosities in Torment Difficulties have significantly increased in quality. There are now increased chances to acquire Legendary, Unique, and Ancestral items.

Developer’s Note: This season, we’re focusing on Lair Bosses and their role in the player journey. Unique items find themselves pulled in two directions. On one side, they are must-find, build-enabling, pieces of gear with one-of-a-kind powers. On the other, they are super rare items to strive for that create moments of celebration once acquired. In previous seasons, Lair Bosses leaned heavily towards supporting the former. In our next season, we want to push more towards a middle-ground, where standard Unique items are readily attainable through Initiate and Greater Lair Bosses, but the path Ancestral Unique items lie directly through defeating the Exalted Lair Boss, Belial, Lord of Lies. Because Belial can reward Ancestral Uniques, we want to give players more freedom on how they get to him. By allowing Initiate and Greater Lair Bosses to have a chance at dropping any Unique item, these bosses should always feel more relevant to fight. Finally, while we like the social element of bossing, the efficiency gained from doing so in a full party is too high. Adjusting the boss summoning flow aims to make the experience more equitable regardless of party size while retaining a small bonus for social play.

  • Common quality items will no longer drop beyond Level 6. Magic quality items will be the most prevalent until around Level 25 whenRare and beyond items start to take precedent.
  • Magic items will now appear with 1-2 Affixes, with 2 Affixes becoming standard as player’s level increases.
  • Rare items now always appear with 2-3 Affixes, with 3 Affixes becoming more common as your level increases.
  • Legendary Item changes
    • Legendary item drop rates have been reduced during levelling.

Developer’s Note: We've increasing the power of Magic and Rare items during levelling while reducing the Legendary item drop rates to address feedback about Legendaries too quickly become the only item rarity you care about.

  • Hoard Key drop chances have been reduced.
  • The Infernal Hordes Aether Reward from the Butcher increased from 25 to 75.

Lair Boss Updates

All Lair Bosses have been updated to make their fights more challenging and engaging. This includes increased health and damage across the board, and changes to the fight itself.

Duriel

  • New fight mechanics.

Lord Zir

  • Lord Zir's damage has been significantly increased. Added a warning cone to help players see it coming.
  • Lord Zir's blood puddles have been reworked. Fewer of them spawn but can grow larger.
  • Lord Zir now summons more Bloodseekers with higher health and damage.

Gregoire

  • New mechanics added to the boss arena.

Varshan

  • Each monster absorbed by Tormented Echo of Varshan now turns into a persistent seeking projectile.

Developer’s Note: Tormented Echo of Varshan's Malignant monster summon and absorption mechanic was complicated, not well communicated and can provide Uber Varshan with some potentially frustrating bonuses (Such as constant shield regeneration and on-hit blind). This change is aimed at making it clearer to the player what is happening.

Beast in the Ice

  • Various minor tweaks to the encounter.

User Interface and User Experience

  • Adjusted the capitalization of the words Element and Elemental when referring to a damage type to properly match other descriptions.
  • We’ve named 3 damage types that were previously unnamed:
    • Shadow Damage over time has been renamed to Corruption Damage.
    • Cold Damage Over Time has been renamed to Frostbite Damage.
    • Lightning Damage Over Time has been renamed to Sparking Damage.
  • Tooltips for socketable items have been adjusted to improve clarity on what items can be socketed into what.
  • Automatic sorting in the Inventory and Stash has been updated to be more intuitive. Now, auto-sort will push the most relevant items to the front. This includes better sorting by rarity and presence of Greater Affixes.
  • The pip on the Map tab in the game menu will no longer appear if the only new item is a Cosmetic.
  • Crafting recipes that do not cost Gold will no longer display a cost, which was always 0.

Miscellaneous

  • Experience received from monster kills until Level 25 has been reduced.

Developer’s Note: Player power has grown considerably with the re-introduction of Seasonal Power systems. This creates a disjointed early game experience, where the pace of leveling vs. other elements of progression are not aligned. This change reduces the need to constantly upgrade early game items, increases the relative value of activity and seasonal rewards, and creates a more seamless early game journey.

  • Players in a party can now quickly teleport to other members of the party through the Social menu.
  • Cosmetic items can now be consumed and unlocked while playing any Class.
  • Conduit Shrines will no longer appear.

Developer’s Note: We have heard feedback on the Conduit shrines. We are disabling them until further notice while reworking them.

  • Skills that cost health will now fail to cast if the cost is higher than the player's current health, instead of reducing the player to 1 health.

Bug Fixes

Accessibility

  • Fixed an issue where the Screen Reader didn’t read everything in the Codex of Power menu when on Controller.
  • Fixed an issue where the Screen Reader read Activity information before reading the popup for a successful party listing.
  • Fixed an issue where page controls were not read by the Screen Reader during Character Creation when launching the game for the first time.
  • Fixed an issue where Character Names would be read aloud when leaving the player's screen.

Gameplay

Barbarian

  • Fixed an issue where Executioner's Aspect was not increasing when on a Two-Hand Weapon or Amulet.
  • Fixed an issue where Bold Chieftain's Aspect would not work properly when casting two shouts simultaneously.
  • Fixed an issue where the Ugly Bastard Helm was affecting some sources of indirect damage, such as Thorns.
  • Fixed an issue where the bonus Fury granted by the Aspect of Slaking was not granted while in town.
  • Fixed a bug that caused all versions of Earthquake to deal twice as much damage as intended.
  • Fixed an issue where the Dust Devils and Earthquakes formed by Call of the Ancients while using Arreat's Bearing were not correctly scaling with Ultimate or Summoning Skill damage bonuses.
  • Fixed an issue where Mighty Throw did not properly benefit from Weapon Expertise.
  • Fixed an issue where Earthquake damage didn't fully benefit from the Rumble Glyph.
  • Fixed an issue where Fury generated from the Berserk Fury aspect did not count towards the Devilish Aspect.
  • Fixed an issue where Call of Ancients could spawn unlimited Ancients. Ancients are now capped at 12.
  • Fixed an issue where the Unconstrained Key Passive was extending the duration of Berserking.
  • Fixed an issue where increasing the size of Mighty Throw also reduced its Lucky Hit Chance.
  • Fixed an issue where Expose Vulnerability Passive would override the duration of Vulnerable if the attack was otherwise going to apply Vulnerable, such as with Power Kick.
  • Fixed an issue where Iron Maelstrom's second and third attack could occasionally have an incorrect cooldown.

Druid

  • Fixed an issue where Nature's Fury would stop working when attacking with Lightning Storm in rare instances.
  • Fixed an issue where Stone Burst defaulted to exploding at its Rank 2 size regardless of its Rank when channeled.
  • Fixed an issue where Shroud of False Death could reduce the number of summonable companions.
  • Fixed an issue where Aspect of the Blurred Beast did not add the damage increase on all instances of Shred.
  • Fixed an issue where the effect from Mjölnic Ryng could randomly stop functioning.
  • Fixed an issue where the Mending passive did not function when using Insatiable Fury.
  • Fixed an issue where Hurricane Size tempering affixes weren't consistent when enhancing hurricanes around wolf companions when using Aspect of Wolf's Rain.
  • Fixed an issue where the Stormshifter's Aspect did not actually grant as many Shapeshifting skill ranks as expected in certain scenarios.
  • Fixed an issue where Damage vs Distant Enemies did not consistently apply to bonus damage to Storm Skills from the Thunderstruck Legendary Paragon Node.
  • Fixed an issue where Iron Fur would snapshot its bonus when using Insatiable Fury.

Necromancer

  • Fixed an issue where casting Bone Spear with Indira's Memory equipped always drained life instead of only when a corpse was present and when an additional Bone Spear spawned.
  • Fixed an issue where Indira's Memory additional Bone Spears spawned even when there was no additional Corpse to consume.
  • Fixed a bug where The Unmaker would trigger on itself when casting Soulrift and using certain Lucky Hit effects.
  • Fixed an issue where Bone Prison was weaker than intended.
  • Fixed an issue where Bone Storm's Lucky Hit Chance was slightly less than the intended 40%.
  • Fixed an issue where Deadraiser Paragon Glyph was not properly applying to all Minion bonus damage Paragon Nodes.
  • Fixed an issue where Indira's Memory could drain the player's life to 1 and prevent normal regeneration.

Developer’s Note: Indira's Memory will no longer trigger if the player's health is 10% or lower.

  • Fixed an issue where fewer than intended Bone Spears would pierce enemies with Indira's Memory equipped.
  • Fixed an issue where the Second Bone Spear from Deathless Visage didn't heal the player with the Supernatural Bone Spear upgrade equipped.
  • Fixed an issue where Bone Spear did not Overpower consistently.
  • Fixed an issue where the Aspect of Shielding Storm could generate Barrier without Bone Storm damaging enemies.
  • Fixed an issue where the Blood Boiling Aspect did not communicate the maximum number of Volatile Blood drops that could be spawned at once was 3.
  • Fixed an issue where Hewed Flesh Passive would not trigger on some enemies.
  • Fixed an issue where Acolyte's Reap would not spawn a Corpse when used against certain enemy types.

Rogue

  • Fixed an issue where the Aspect of Iron Rain could have a trigger chance exceeding 100%.

Developer’s Note: This aspect will now always roll at 100% chance and the only variance is the damage of the Arrow Storm.

  • Fixed an issue where using Imbued Skills or any Basic Skill with the Coldclip Aspect always counted as using a Cooldown for Beastfall Boots.
  • Fixed an issue where Beastfall Boots would not empower Trap Skills when they were also Core Skills due to Scoundrel's Leathers.
  • Fixed an issue where Saboteur's Signet and Trickster's Aspect spawned fewer grenades and the grenades did less damage than expected.
  • Fixed an issue where Rare Agile Augments tempering recipe had Chance for Flurry to Consume No Charges instead of Chance for Flurry to Deal Double Damage.
  • Fixed an issue where Shadow Clones would not benefit from the Dagger or Bow bonuses of the Weapon Mastery Passive.
  • Fixed an issue where your Shadow Clone's Caltrops were not properly granting the effects of Enhanced Caltrops.
  • Fixed an issue where Shadow Clone from Grasp of Shadows could not duplicate Caltrops.
  • Fixed an issue where Shadow Clone would occasionally stop functioning if you moved too far away from it.
  • Fixed an issue where Subverting Poison Trap would not properly apply its bonus when applied from your Shadow Clone.
  • Fixed an issue where Shadow Imbuement and Poison Imbuement, when applied by your Shadow Clone, wouldn’t deal increased damage with bonuses that affect Shadow Clone, such as Ultimate Skill Damage.
  • Fixed an issue where Grasp of Shadows was triggering more often than intended.
  • Fixed an issue that was causing Aspect of Arrow Storms and Vengeful Aspect to proc a second Arrow Storm when hitting an enemy with Enhanced Shadow Step.

Sorcerer

  • Fixed various instances where the Incinerate Enchantment didn't interact properly with the Aspect of Conflagration.
  • Fixed an issue where the second slash from Arc Lash did not have a visual effect.
  • Fixed an issue where Elemental Synergies were improperly adding the Fire damage bonus for Familiars along with its current element even if the Familiar changed elements.
  • Fixed an issue where Shatter's explosion didn't damage bosses after the stagger period ended.
  • Fixed an issue where the Energy Focus passive was dropping entirely after taking damage.
  • Fixed an issue where Sidhe Bindings were not always gaining increased ranks to Primordial Binding when Masterworked.
  • Fixed an issue where Inner Flame granted more damage against Healthy enemies than intended.
  • Fixed an issue where Prime Deep Freeze would not benefit from Barrier Generation.
  • Fixed an issue where Aspect of Conflagration would snapshot when an Incinerate Enchantment Hydra attacked.
  • Fixed an issue where increasing Flame Shield's Burn area would not increase its visual effect size.
  • Fixed an issue where the Firebolt splitting effect from Flameweaver's aspect was not consistent when standing near a Firewall.
  • Fixed an issue where players would receive less Teleport cooldown than intended from Aspect of the Bounding Conduit when adding ranks to Teleport.
  • Fixed an issue where Winter Touch Aspect was not gaining the Vulnerable and damage benefits from the initial cast of Frost Nova.
  • Fixed an issue where Ice Shard's targeting was inconsistent when enemies were close to the player.

General

  • Fixed an issue where the damage variance toggle didn’t properly function in the Training Grounds.
  • Fixed an issue where Aspect of Elements' bonus could occasionally be removed from the player or repeat the same bonus after swapping weapons.
  • Fixed an issue where Crown of Lucion would occasionally prevent other sources of increased damage from functioning properly.
  • Fixed an issue where Gloves of the Illuminator would not properly interact with Crown of Lucion.
  • Fixed an issue where Ancestral Caches from the Tree of Whispers did not always drop Ancestral items.
  • Fixed an issue where climbing a Traversal could fail if the player continuously held directional input while navigating the Traversal.
  • Fixed an issue where the Helltide Commander for the Portal Invasion event could fail to spawn if the player was benefitting from Stealth effects when the Commander spawned.
  • Fixed an issue where some events and event masteries could be completed by using Stealth effects to avoid monsters.
  • Fixed an issue where Echo of Lilith could become invincible during the first phase of the encounter.
  • Fixed an issue where Crackling Energy, Volatile Orbs from the Blood Boiling Aspect, and Blood Orbs could not be picked up while Crowd Controlled.
  • Fixed an issue where repeatedly casting a Channeled Skill could spawn missiles from Tyrael's Might.
  • Fixed an issue where multiple Accursed Rituals could appear in the same Helltide Zone.
  • Fixed an issue where Andariel and Lilith would perform all 4 of their phases at 1 HP instead of at their proper life thresholds.

Party Finder

  • Fixed an issue where Vessel of Hatred-exclusive bosses could be set as a Party Finder activity for players who did not own Vessel of Hatred.
  • Fixed an issue where Party Finder listings could not be created from the map for Strongholds.

User Interface and User Experience

Barbarian

  • Fixed an issue where the descriptions for the Slaking Aspect did match between the Aspect on an Item and in the Codex of Power.
  • Fixed an issue where the description for the Luckbringer Aspect displayed the Lucky Hit Chance bonus as multiplicative instead of additive.
  • Fixed an issue where the increased Critical Strike Chance from the No Mercy passive didn’t display in the Character Stats panel while in town.

Druid

  • Fixed an issue where the tooltip for Airidah's Inexorable Will did not clearly describe the power.
  • Fixed an issue where Innate Blood Howl was not displaying.
  • Fixed an issue where Hurricane damage displayed would not increase with duration bonuses.
  • Fixed an issue where the bonus description for Lupine Ferocity had incorrect information.
  • Fixed an issue where the description for Enhanced Claw displayed its Attack Speed bonus as additive instead of multiplicative.
  • Fixed an issue where the description for Malefic Crescent said damage was increased "to" instead of increased "by."

Necromancer

  • Fixed an issue where damage bonuses from Golems, Skeleton Mages, and Skeleton Warriors were not displayed in the Character Stats panel.
  • Fixed an issue where Aspect of Shielding Storm did not display the decimal value on Amulets.

Sorcerer

  • Fixed an issue where the Aspect of Elemental Constellation description suggested all skills needed to be cast instead of any of the listed types.
  • Fixed an issue where the Aspect of Piercing static reduced the displayed damage number for Charged Bolts.
  • Fixed an issue where the Mind's Awakening Aspect did not display the Barrier duration.

All Classes

  • Fixed an issue where the Aspect of Metamorphosis Codex of Power description did not include how the Aspect affects evade.
  • Fixed an issue where Heir of Perdition's description did not accurately state the distance at which it will steal Mother's Favor from allies.

General

  • Fixed an issue where items couldn’t be marked as Junk or Favorited after interacting with the Occultist.
  • Fixed an issue where the amount a player was over the Movement Speed maximum wasn’t displayed in Character Stats.
  • Fixed an issue where the Malignant Heart crafting recipe didn’t have a prompt to show the required materials to craft it.
  • Fixed an issue where the UI header to denote Difficulty and Hardcore status was not displayed while in the Pit.
  • Fixed an issue where UI displays for Wave number and Aether amount were inaccurate when playing Infernal Hordes in Local Co-Op.
  • Fixed an issue where Scroll Speed in the Skill Tree menu was faster than intended when playing on controller.
  • Fixed an issue where notifications for a spawning World Boss could display when no World Boss was spawning.
  • Fixed an issue where the icon for maximum Helltide threat did not change when resetting threats.

Miscellaneous

  • Fixed an issue where the Master Tactician achievement did not reward the appropriate title.
  • Fixed an issue where Aspect of Assistance was dropping before an Ultimate Skill was available.
  • Fixed an issue where the Mirage quest could not be completed properly.
  • Fixed an issue where the Reanimation and Ossein Assault challenges for the Necromancer did not progress from enemies killed by minions.
  • Various stability, performance, UI, visual, and audio improvements.

item.title: The Past And Present Of Fantasy RPGs Just Had Amazing Weekends On PC And Console

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Fantasy fans are eating well right now, as last week saw the release of not one but two highly anticipated games in that genre. After a few brief leaks, The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion remaster was shadow-dropped onto PC and console, and just two days later, Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 was officially released on the same platforms. Could both games co-exist in this swords and sorcery space together? It turns out that they could indeed, as both titles experienced solid weekends on PC, particularly.

While we don't know what their performance metrics were like on Xbox Series X|S--where both Oblivion and Expedition 33 are available via Game Pass--and PS5, the numbers sound positive so far for Expedition 33 and Oblivion Remastered. Developer Sandfall Interactive first reported 500,000 sales of Expedition 33 just 24 hours after launch, and after three days, that figure had climbed to 1 million sales. "This number includes units shipped to retailers, and does not encompass our awesome GamePass players," Sandfall Interactive added in a follow-up post.

And here we are.
Three days after launch.
One million copies sold.
Thank you for believing in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33. pic.twitter.com/92T2qZxcHP

— Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 (@expedition33) April 27, 2025

On Steam, the game reached an impressive concurrent peak of 121,422 players, and combined with players from other PC platforms like the Epic Games Store and Game Pass alongside Xbox Series X|S, and PS5, the overall numbers are likely very high during the game's first weekend.

In comparison, Oblivion Remastered reached over 4 million players just days after it was released. "We are so grateful to the over 4 million of you that have already ventured into Cyrodiil with Oblivion Remastered," Bethesda said in a post on X/Twitter. In terms of concurrent players on Steam alone, the game reached a peak of 216,784 people on April 27, and similar to Expedition 33, its availability on several platforms, storefronts, and Xbox Game Pass also means that the final numbers are likely even higher.

We are so grateful to the over 4 million of you that have already ventured into Cyrodiil with Oblivion Remastered. Thank you! pic.twitter.com/Fz1lo7XZtM

— Bethesda Game Studios (@BethesdaStudios) April 25, 2025

Despite being set in the fantasy genre, both games do offer wildly different experiences. Oblivion Remastered brings the classic Elder Scrolls experience to new platforms in an enhanced package, but hilariously, some of its key bugs have been retained. Meanwhile, Expedition 33 is shaping up to be a strong game of the year contender thanks to its elegant art direction and gameplay that puts an action-packed twist on the traditional turn-based RPG format.

Bethesda Game Studios recently congratulated Sandfall Interactive on the launch of Clair Obscur: Expedition 33, and Ben Starr--who voices Verso in Expedition 33--spoke to GameSpot about the silver lining of having these two games release so closely to each other.
